subject: Re: How to log JUnits Tests
msgSnippet: The ant JUnit task logs everything that s written to System.out or System.error. It doesn t matter what library writes the log messages. The Ant JUnitReport
messageBody:
The ant JUnit task logs everything that's written to System.out or
System.error.
It doesn't matter what library writes the log messages.

The Ant JUnitReport task does not use this output, but other
solutions exist that do write the output to a report.

Regards, Jan


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "isowitz" <isowitz@...> wrote:
>
> I have to rewrite existing tests in JUnit tests. The old tests logs
> with a java.util.logging.Logger, e.g. starttime, start sendind
data,
> start recieving data, the recieved data etc. - in a word they logs
> all that can be logged.
> Should I use the java.util.logging.Logger for JUnit too or is that
> the bad way?
>
> You spoke about reports of my result. What other kind of reports
> exists?
>
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, didoss@ wrote:
> >
> > What do you mean by logging,...do you mean reports of your
results -
> then Google JUnitReport.
> >
> > -------------- Original message --------------
> > From: "isowitz" <isowitz@>
> > I have a problem with logging JUnit tests. In a package I have a
> > AllTests class that calls several tests. The result of that tests
> > should be logged.
> > I'm not familiar with JUnit or logging so I try to find examples
in
> the
> > web. Unfortunately i found no examples or hints for me.
> >
> > How do you log your JUnit results?
> >
